venue.name: Microsoft New England Research and Development Center

item.description:
MuCash: Micro-payments for Blogs

Monday, Aug 29th, 2011 from 7:00pm - 9:00pm

By Ben Oaks

The way people find and consume content on the Internet is changing, while advertising prices keep declining.  This means that bloggers today need to find new and better ways to keep their blog profitable.  MuCash offers a new, option allowing blogs to accept payments of as little as a penny.  These transactions can be donations or can even a-la-cart purchases of post.  Readers are never redirected from your site and transactions take a little as 2 clicks.

See the MuCash WordPress plugin:

http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/mucash-micro-payments/

Agenda

  • 7-7:30pm - Networking, pizza
  • 7:30-7:40pm - Opening remarks, updates, any other business
  • 7:45-8:50pm - Presentation begins
  • 8:50-9pm - Wrap-up

Ben is a Co-Founder of MuCash and is responsible for the business side of MuCash.  While he has a diverse background that spans work in Fortune 50 companies, small businesses, government and non-profits, his passion is for creating new things.  He has an MBA from Cornell University.  Ben handles the non-technical aspects of the business, including business development, marketing, partnerships, etc…
item.name: CANCELLED: BWPM Aug 2011: MuCash: Micro-payments for Blogs
